support_summary: ATXN3 regulates the activity of the E3 ligase Parkin, which in turn monoubiquitinates the autophagy inhibitor Bcl-2.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 regulates the E3 ligase activity of Parkin. Parkin can monoubiquitinate the anti-autophagic protein Bcl-2. By modulating Parkin, ATXN3 indirectly influences the inhibition of autophagy by Bcl-2.
functions.effect_description: By counteracting Parkin's auto-ubiquitination, ATXN3 keeps Parkin active, allowing it to ubiquitinate Bcl-2, which in turn promotes the initiation of autophagy.
biological_consequence: Regulation of Parkin activity → Ubiquitination of Bcl-2 → Dissociation of Beclin-1 from Bcl-2 → Autophagy initiation
specific_effects: ATXN3 regulates the activity of Parkin, which ubiquitinates the autophagy inhibitor Bcl-2.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

consequences: ATXN3 inhibits Parkin's E3 ligase activity → Reduced mono-ubiquitination and stabilization of Bcl-2 by Parkin → Weakened Bcl-2/Beclin-1 interaction → Autophagy initiation

mechanism: ATXN3 regulates the E3 ligase activity of Parkin. Parkin can monoubiquitinate the anti-autophagic protein Bcl-2. By modulating Parkin, ATXN3 indirectly influences the inhibition of autophagy by Bcl-2.
effect: By counteracting Parkin's auto-ubiquitination, ATXN3 keeps Parkin active, allowing it to ubiquitinate Bcl-2, which in turn promotes the initiation of autophagy.
summary: ATXN3 activates Bcl-2 to modulate autophagy, ultimately affecting autophagy initiation.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
